sub_topic: Identifying the maximum independent set in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following unweighted undirected graph with 8 vertices: 

![Graph](https://i.imgur.com/j7lCzUS.png)

What is the maximum number of independent vertices that can be chosen from this graph? In other words, what is the size of the maximum independent set?
message_2:
An independent set is a set of vertices in a graph such that no two vertices are adjacent. To find the maximum independent set, we need to select the maximum number of vertices such that no two vertices are connected by an edge.

In the given graph, we can choose the following vertices to form the maximum independent set: {1, 4, 5, 7}. No two of these vertices are connected by an edge, and it is not possible to add any more vertices to this set without violating the independence condition.

Therefore, the size of the maximum independent set is 4.
